definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: River is the ultimate receiving water of the urban wastewater.
sentences.chinese: 河流是城市污水的最终受纳体。

sentences.english: Different enviromental informations are readed and accepted by neuroendocrine cells.
sentences.chinese: 不同的环境信息被神经分泌细胞“解读”和“受纳”。

sentences.english: The aquatic pollution caused by the combined sewerage overflow in raining day on the water accepting body has increasingly come to our attention.
sentences.chinese: 排水系统雨天溢流对受纳水体的污染已日益受到关注。

definition: spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
to obstruct/to stop up/to heap soil around the roots of a plant
five viscera of TCM, namely: heart 心[xin1], liver 肝[gan1], spleen 脾[pi2], lungs 肺[fei4] and kidneys 腎|肾[shen4]
bladder 氣|气[qi4] transformation in TCM
(TCM) the three truncal cavities (thoracic, abdominal and pelvic), known as the "triple heater" or "San Jiao"

(TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
bodily fluids (general term in Chinese medicine)
